p: HMGR in plants is considered the most important enzyme for regulating the MVA pathway; it is regulated at the levels of transcription, post-transcription, translation and post-translation [ 36]. As expected, overexpression of HMGR enzyme in tobacco, spike lavender, tomato, Arabidopsis and ginseng has been reported to increase sterol content [ 36]. In the case of Artemisia annua it was also reported an increase in artemisinin production [ 54]; in Salvia miltiorrhiza total tanshinone production was enhanced [ 55]; and in Panax ginseng triterpene saponin production increased [ 56]. However, spike lavender is the only plant model were an increase of non-mevalonate metabolites is noted after overexpression of the HMGR enzyme [ 37].
